Class Ingredient

java.lang.Object
Ingredient
public class Ingredient extends Object
The Ingredient class represents a single ingredient used in a recipe. It stores information such as the name, amount, unit of measurement, and calories per unit. It also provides a method to calculate the total calories based on the amount and calories per unit.

  • Constructor Summary

      Default constructor initializes the ingredient with empty values and zero amounts.

    • Ingredient

      public Ingredient(String nameOfIngredient, float ingredientAmount, String unitMeasurement, int numberCaloriesPerUnit)
      Constructs a new Ingredient with the given properties.
      Parameters:
      nameOfIngredient - the name of the ingredient
      ingredientAmount - the amount of the ingredient
      unitMeasurement - the unit of measurement (e.g., cups, tsp)
      numberCaloriesPerUnit - the number of calories per unit

    • getTotalCalories

      public float getTotalCalories()
      Calculates and returns the total calories of the ingredient.
      Returns:

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a formatted string representing the ingredient.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
